alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Guadalupe County; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 25 at 2:25AM MST until January 26 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Jemez Mountains, Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Central Highlands, and Guadalupe County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 and US Highway 285. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Guadalupe County; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood
